page.title: 05Hesketh Park
page.content: Hesketh Park is situated, so that it is within walking distance of Lord Street. It attracts many thousands of visitors annually. The 30.39 acre park has amongst its many attractions approximately 9,000 trees, a garden for the blind and a floral clock garden. There is an astronomical observatory and a conservatory where tropical plants are grown, both opened in 1869. The children's area is equipped with swings, a slide, a roundabout, a see-saw and sandpit. We think it is absolutely fantastic and there is a cafe nearby.
